Class Jugador

java.lang.Object
com.example.fpoe_50zo.model.player.Jugador
All Implemented Interfaces:
IJugador
Direct Known Subclasses:
JugadorMaquina
public class Jugador extends Object implements IJugador
Represents a base player in the "Cincuentazo" game. This class holds the player's hand and basic info. It's intended to be extended by specific player types (like JugadorMaquina).

  • Constructor Details

    • Jugador

      public Jugador(String nombre, boolean esHumano)
      Constructs a new Player.
      Parameters:
      nombre - The display name for the player.
      esHumano - true if this is a human-controlled player, false otherwise.

  • Method Details

    • tomarCarta

      public void tomarCarta(IMazo mazo) throws MazoVacioException
      Draws a card from the deck and adds it to the player's hand.
      Specified by:
      tomarCarta in interface IJugador
      Parameters:
      mazo - The deck to draw from.
      Throws:
      MazoVacioException - if the deck is empty.

    • jugarCarta

      public boolean jugarCarta(Carta carta)
      Removes a specific card from the player's hand. This is called when a player successfully plays a card.
      Specified by:
      jugarCarta in interface IJugador
      Parameters:
      carta - The card to be played (and removed).
      Returns:
      true if the card was in the hand and removed, false otherwise.

    • puedeJugar

      public boolean puedeJugar(int sumaMesa)
      Checks if the player has at least one valid move. This is crucial for the "elimination" rule.
      Specified by:
      puedeJugar in interface IJugador
      Parameters:
      sumaMesa - The current sum on the table.
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least one card that can be played without exceeding 50, false otherwise.

    • dejarMano

      public List<Carta> dejarMano()
      Returns the player's entire hand. Used when a player is eliminated, to return their cards to the deck.
      Specified by:
      dejarMano in interface IJugador
      Returns:
      A List containing all cards from the player's hand.

    • getMano

      public List<Carta> getMano()
      Specified by:
      getMano in interface IJugador
      Returns:
      The player's hand (as an unmodifiable list to prevent external changes).
